sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Prepaid Wireless 9-1-1 Surcharge Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Prepaid Wireless 9-1-1 Surcharge Act.

sections.heading: Purpose. The General Assembly finds and declares that maintaining effective and efficient 9-1-1 systems across the State benefits all citizens
sections.text: The fees imposed upon the consumers of telecommunication services that have the ability to dial 9-1-1 are an important funding mechanism to assist the Stat

sections.heading: Liability of sellers and providers
sections.text: The provisions of Section 50 of the Wireless Emergency Telephone Safety Act shall apply to sellers and providers of prepaid wireless telecommunications service.

sections.heading: Home rule.   A home rule unit may not impose a separate surcharge on wireless 9-1-1 service in addition to the surcharge imposed on wireless 9-1-1 service under this Act
sections.text: This Section is a denial and limitation of home rule powers and functions under subsection (h) of Section 6 of Article VII of th

sections.heading: Exclusivity of prepaid wireless 9-1-1 surcharge
sections.text: The prepaid wireless 9-1-1 surcharge imposed by this Act shall be the only 9-1-1 funding obligation imposed with respect to prepaid wireless telecommunications service in this State. No tax, fee, surcharge, or other charge shall be imposed by this Sta

sections.heading: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.
sections.text: Severability. The provisions of this Act are severable under Section 1.31 of the Statute on Statutes.

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2012, except that this Section and Section 90 shall take effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect January 1, 2012, except that this Section and Section 90 shall take effect upon becoming law.
